defs.docs: A global executor built on top of async-executor and async_io

attributes.value: / A global executor built on top of async-executor and async_io
/ The global executor is lazily spawned on first use. It spawns as many threads
/ as the number of cpus by default. You can override this using the
/ // spawn a task on the multi-threaded executor
/ // spawn a task on the local executor (same thread)

defs.name: GlobalExecutorConfig
defs.docs: Configuration to init the thread pool for the multi-threaded global executor.

attributes.value: / Configuration to init the thread pool for the multi-threaded global executor.

defs.name: with_env_var
defs.docs: Use the specified environment variable to find the number of threads to spawn.

attributes.value: / Use the specified environment variable to find the number of threads to spawn.

defs.name: with_min_threads
defs.docs: Use the specified value as the minimum number of threads.

attributes.value: / Use the specified value as the minimum number of threads.

defs.name: with_max_threads
defs.docs: Use the specified value as the maximum number of threads.

attributes.value: / Use the specified value as the maximum number of threads.

defs.name: with_thread_name_fn
defs.value:
pub fn with_thread_name_fn<impl Fn() -> String + Send + Sync + 'static: Fn()
                           -> String + Send + Sync +
                           'static>(Self,
                                    impl Fn() -> String + Send + Sync + 'static)
-> Self
defs.docs: Use the specified prefix to name the threads.

attributes.value: / Use the specified prefix to name the threads.

defs.name: block_on
defs.value: pub fn block_on<F: Future<Output = T>, T>(F) -> T
defs.docs: Runs the global and the local executor on the current thread

attributes.value: / Runs the global and the local executor on the current thread

defs.name: spawn
defs.value:
pub fn spawn<F: Future<Output = T> + Send + 'static, T: Send + 'static>(F)
-> Task<T>
defs.docs: Spawns a task onto the multi-threaded global executor.

attributes.value: / Spawns a task onto the multi-threaded global executor.

defs.name: spawn_local
defs.value: pub fn spawn_local<F: Future<Output = T> + 'static, T: 'static>(F) -> Task<T>
defs.docs: Spawns a task onto the local executor.

attributes.value: / Spawns a task onto the local executor.
/ The task does not need to be `Send` as it will be spawned on the same thread.

defs.name: spawn_blocking
defs.value:
pub async fn spawn_blocking<F: FnOnce() -> T + Send + 'static, T: Send +
                            'static>(F) -> /*impl Trait*/
defs.docs: Runs blocking code on a thread pool.

attributes.value: / Runs blocking code on a thread pool.
/ Read the contents of a file:

defs.name: init_with_config
defs.docs:
Init the global executor, spawning as many threads as specified or
 the value specified by the specified environment variable.

attributes.value: / Init the global executor, spawning as many threads as specified or
/ the value specified by the specified environment variable.

defs.name: init
defs.docs:
Init the global executor, spawning as many threads as the number or cpus or
 the value specified by the `ASYNC_GLOBAL_EXECUTOR_THREADS` environment variable
 if specified.

attributes.value: / Init the global executor, spawning as many threads as the number or cpus or
/ the value specified by the `ASYNC_GLOBAL_EXECUTOR_THREADS` environment variable

defs.name: spawn_more_threads
defs.docs: Spawn more executor threads, up to configured max value.

attributes.value: / Spawn more executor threads, up to configured max value.
/ Returns how many threads we spawned.

defs.name: stop_thread
defs.docs: Stop one of the executor threads, down to configured min value

attributes.value: / Stop one of the executor threads, down to configured min value
/ Returns whether a thread has been stopped.

defs.name: stop_current_thread
defs.docs: Stop the current executor thread, if we exceed the configured min value

attributes.value: / Stop the current executor thread, if we exceed the configured min value
/ Returns whether the thread has been stopped.
